body_html: If pooling doesn't natively support it, it's still probably worth getting this CL in, but will require a bit more work, in that you'd have to retain the stride > ksize checking for pooling (essentially forking the python shape code that's currently shared between conv2d and pooling ops). Let's hope Eigen / Cudnn already support this:)
body_text: If pooling doesn't natively support it, it's still probably worth getting this CL in, but will require a bit more work, in that you'd have to retain the stride > ksize checking for pooling (essentially forking the python shape code that's currently shared between conv2d and pooling ops).  Let's hope Eigen / Cudnn already support this:)
body: If pooling doesn't natively support it, it's still probably worth getting this CL in, but will require a bit more work, in that you'd have to retain the stride > ksize checking for pooling (essentially forking the python shape code that's currently shared between conv2d and pooling ops).  Let's hope Eigen / Cudnn already support this:)
